Discussions.Discussion_Name: Clean Space Days 2024 (8-11 Oct) in ESTEC

Messages.Author: Cem Avsar
Messages.Content: The Clean Space Days will take place in ESTEC from 8 to 11 October 2024.  https://indico.esa.int/e/CSD2024  We were informed that there is a poster session for students who want to present their work (10 posters). Up to three students can receive an ESA Academy Scholarship of up to 700 Euros to cover travel costs and accommodation. The event is free of charge. The abstract deadline will be extended to mid-August.

Messages.Author: Winfred Selwyn Ooh Azlin
Messages.Content: Hello Prof. Avsar,  Unfortunately, the poster session is only open to citizens of the EU: https://indico.esa.int/event/516/page/849-clean-space-days-student-poster-session  - Be a citizen of an ESA Member State, Canada, Latvia, Lithuania, Slovakia or Slovenia;

Messages.Author: Manuel Ortega
Messages.Content: Dear all,   The RADIAN company is offering a thermal analysis tool for universities, aimed at simulating space hardware. Below you will find a webinar, and an example for a cubesat mission.  "Practical Session: Simplifying Thermal Analysis for Universities" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cYUshtzHsfM   In this other link you can see another video (10 mins) with a demo of our thermal analysis software with an example of a cubesat: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DJU_3tSNung  If interested, don't hesitate to contact: laura@radian.systems

Messages.Author: Cem Avsar
Messages.Content: Dear Students, The organizers of the ILR party are looking for volunteers. From my experience, it's also a good opportunity to get to know people from different work groups inside the institute. Please contact Alexander Richter as soon as possible if you are interested in helping out: alexander.richter@ilr.tu-berlin.de The party is scheduled for the 5th of July. Announcements will follow. For clarification, the ILR party is a party for all staff and students of the Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics.

Messages.Author: Alexander Richter
Messages.Content: Hi together!  thanks Cem for the announcement! We are really happy about all kind of help. Last years we always had a hotdog-bar which sadly got canceled this year. So we re especially hardly looking for an alternative. If any of you would have ideas on this, lets meet and exchange ideas! But we re also looking for support at the bar ; ) In any way, most important is to save the date! ; ) Hope to see many of you there! Cheers, Alex

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Fireside chat with Hans Koenigsmann, former Vice President and Chief Engineer at SpaceX on 28. June

Messages.Author: Olga Homakova
Messages.Content: Aim for the stars to land on …? – a berlin born engineer on his mission to Mars. Dr. Hans Königsmann is the former Vice President of Flight Reliability at SpaceX. He also served as the company's Chief Engineer responsible for avionics and was SpaceX's fourth employee. Being an essential part of SpaceX rise from its foundation in 2002 to the world’s leading space exploration company, Hans Königsmann's career has been truly cinematic. On June 28th, we have the unique opportunity to hear about his journey from being a diploma student at TU Berlin to constructing and launching the world’s most advanced rockets. We are thrilled to welcome him as our guest at TU Berlin! The event is free and open to students from all fields, employees and external parties. The event will be held in English. Tickets are limited, so sign up for the event today! https://www.tu.berlin/en/event-details/events/event/018fe2bc-e69e-7cc8-b314-8bdc889c10c6

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Student position for NewSpace editorial work in Berlin

Messages.Author: Cem Avsar
Messages.Content: The department was asked whether we could forward the following position. German language skills are required.  https://ifg-jobs.softgarden.io/job/42709191?l=de

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Online-Seminar about Space Licensing on 24th June at 18:00

Messages.Author: Cem Avsar
Messages.Content: Dear Students, Feel free to join the next DGLR-Virtual International Group online-seminar for an exclusive talk by Dr.-Ing. Paola Breda. Drawing from hands-on experience with HyImpulse, this interactive seminar will delve into the challenges of space licensing in Europe. As the NewSpace industry rapidly evolves, regulatory processes for space activities are racing to keep up.   Register here You can also join the DGLR VIG newsletter for updates on upcoming events and activities: https://www.dglr.de/vernetzen/bezirksgruppen/virtual-international-group/ It's also worth checking out the affordable student DGLR membership, as it offers many benefits: https://en.dglr.de/index.php?id=455

Messages.Author: Steffen Reinert
Messages.Content: Hallo liebe Studis, Ich möchte euch hiermit zu dem folgenden Event am kommenden Freitag einladen. Im Rahmen des Kurses "Spacecraft Operations" [1] erleben Studierende die operationellen On-Orbit Projektphasen des bereits 2021 gestarteten TU Satelliten TUBIN nach. Dabei sind sie ab Erstkontakt, bis zum Semesterende eigenständig für den Betrieb des Satelliten verantwortlich. Nach wochenlangen Vorbereitungen und Kennenlernen des Satelliten, „startet“ am Freitag, den 31.05.24 14:20 Uhr erneut die Transporter-2 Mission mit einer FALCON 9 Rakete, um TUBIN ins All zu befördern; dieses Mal unter dem Namen 2BIN. Nach Auswurf des Satelliten von der Raketenoberstufe, wird im TU Berlin eigenen Raumflugkontrollzentrum dem Erstkontakt entgegengefiebert. Das Launch Event wird aus dem Kontrollzentrum heraus gestreamt und von Kursteilnehmenden moderiert. Dabei wird präsentiert, wie sich auf den Satellitenbetrieb vorbereitet wurde und der nahende Erstkontakt mit dem Satelliten ablaufen wird. Der Stream [2] startet Freitag, 31.05.2024 ab 13:45 Uhr auf dem fachgebietseigenen YouTube Kanal [3]. Liebe Grüße Steffen Reinert   [1] Modul Spacecraft Operations https://moseskonto.tu-berlin.de/moses/modultransfersystem/bolognamodule/beschreibung/anzeigen.html?nummer=51016&version=1&sprache=1 [2] Launch Event Stream https://youtube.com/live/VtGmpKL2n64 [3] Youtube Kanal "Chair of Space Technology" https://www.youtube.com/@chairofspacetechnologyattu7297

Messages.Author: Cem Avsar
Messages.Content: Dear Students, Prof. Stoll recently mentioned the rich learning resources that NASA offers in the scope of its Small Spacecraft Systems Virtual Institute (S3VI). https://www.nasa.gov/smallsat-institute https://www.nasa.gov/smallsat-institute/systems-engineering-series/ Kind regards, Cem

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Power SystemS Engineer Position at German Orbital Systems

Messages.Author: Cem Avsar
Messages.Content: Dear all, German Orbital Systems is looking for someone (see attachment). This might be interesting for you if you're a recent or soon-to-be graduate. You can also forward this to people in your network that might be a good fit. Kind regards, Cem

Messages.Author: Cem Avsar
Messages.Content: Dear all,  MSE graduate Brian Treacy was at ISISPACE for several years and has now founded the company Turtle Island Space: https://turtleislandspace.com  It offers universities a practical exercise in satellite operations. We already have the capacities in-house. Nevertheless, he invited the lecturers and students of his alma mater to test his exercises. If you are interested, simply follow the instructions in the attached slide. The license key for operating the ground station is valid until the end of May.  He'd be happy if you'd submit your feedback through the brief survey.  Kind regards, Cem

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Guest lecture about Satellites by Prof. Cho on 15th May in MAR 0.003

Messages.Author: Cem Avsar
Messages.Content: Dear Students, Mohamed Khalil Ben-Larbi has invited Professor Mengu Cho (Joint appointment at Kyushu Institute of Technology and Chiba Institute of Technology) for a guest lecture titled „Lean Satellite: Delivering Satellite Values with Low Cost and Short Time“. He's extending his invitation to interested students. Please feel free to join. 15th May 14:00 to 15:30 in MAR 0.003 (no online streaming).

Discussions.Discussion_Name: 17th Pico- and Nano-Satellite Workshop in Berlin on 2nd September 2024

Messages.Author: Cem Avsar
Messages.Content: Message from the PiNa organizers... Dear colleagues and friends, We cordially invite you to participate in the 17th Pico-and Nano-Satellite Workshop “PiNa” on September 2, 2024 in Berlin. Call for Presentations To present at the workshop, one-page, one-column, single-spaced abstract shall be submitted by email to pina@tubspace.de. Abstract submission is open until July 2, 2024. Topics include: Small satellite missions In-orbit experiences Subsystem technologies & Payloads Education & University Operations & Regulatory aspects Registration Registration is available until August 27, 2024 by sending an email to pina@tubspace.de. Please specify your full name and affiliation. Please find all information in the attached flyer and updates on the PiNa 2024 website: https://www.tu.berlin/raumfahrttechnik/konferenzen/pina-2024  We look forward to hearing from you! With best regards, PiNa Team pina@tubspace.de

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Planetarium Lecture - Eine Reise von Berlin,	zu den Sternen

Messages.Author: Olga Homakova
Messages.Content: Dear Students, The Department (Steffen Reinert) is organising a lecture "A journey from Berlin to the stars" in the planetarium in Berlin Prenzlauer Berg. The lecture is part of the course „Grundlagen der Raumfahrttechnik“ of the German-speaking study programme and will be hold in German. For the ones of you who can understand German and want to join, the information on the lecture and link for the registration is below.  Hallo liebe Kolleginnen und Kollegen, am Montag, den 27. Mai von 18:00 – ca. 20:30 Uhr halten Niklas und ich im Zuge meines Kurses „Grundlagen der Raumfahrttechnik“ eine kostenfreie, vorlesungsartige Vorstellung im Planetarium ab. Da wir den Saal mit 300 verfügbaren Plätzen voll machen dürfen, möchte ich euch und eure Liebsten herzlich zu dem Event einladen. Im Folgenden ein Auszug des Veranstaltungstextes: Planetarium Lecture - Eine Reise von Berlin, zu den Sternen Eine Reise, die unter dem Nachthimmel von Berlin beginnt, zur Internationalen Raumstation ISS, über verschiedene Satellitenbahnen bis zum Mond und anderen, ferneren Himmelskörpern führt. Primär richtet sich die Veranstaltung an Studierende des Kurses "Grundlagen der Raumfahrttechnik". Da die Themen keinerlei Vorkenntnisse benötigen, ist jede weitere interessierte Person herzlichst eingeladen sich im Sessel zurückzulehnen und diese Reise zu den Sternen zu wagen. Das Programm bietet sich ebenfalls für junge Nachwuchstalente an. Hinweis Der Einlass ist ab 17:45 Uhr geöffnet. Das Programm wird durch eine Pause in zwei Teile unterteilt. Da der Eintritt kostenfrei ist, können keine Servicekräfte für Garderobe, Snacks oder Getränke engagiert werden. Bitte versorgen Sie sich selbst mit allem, was das Herz begehrt. Veranstaltungsort Zeiss-Großplanetarium Prenzlauer Allee 80, 10405 Berlin https://maps.app.goo.gl/EoDMtHXb6fiqmfXD7 Wenn ihr mit dabei sein wollt, müsst ihr euch auf dem TU-eigenen Veranstaltungs Portal „Congeno“ [1] für das Event, möglichst verbindlich, anmelden. Liebe Grüße Steffen

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Student Workers in Satellite Laser Ranging Operations Recruitment

Messages.Author: Sebastian Herrmann
Messages.Content: Dear students,   DiGOS, a young company for systems engineering in the field of satellite laser ranging, is currently looking for working students for the operation of the ESA SLR station on Tenerife.   You will join a team of other working students and have the possibility to plan your working time flexibly. The office is located near the S-Bahn station Babelsberg in Potsdam, only 27 minutes by S7 from Zoologischer Garten, but after a short training you will be able to work remotely. Depending on your academic background, you may also be involved in other areas in the future. This includes possible topics for a Bachelor's or Master's thesis. This is a great opportunity to get your foot in the door of a growing industry with exciting prospects such as space debris laser ranging and satellite laser communications.   We would particularly like to encourage students who are still in their undergraduate or early postgraduate studies and are looking for long-term employment to apply to us. A working week of 14 to 20 hours is expected.   Please see the attached job advertisement for more information. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact me or hr@digos.eu. If you would like to apply, please send your application to hr@digos.eu.   Best regards, Sebastian Herrmann Working student for DiGOS

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Call for applications: Join the PULSE satellite team to build a space weather monitoring pocketqube (Deadline: 1 May 2024)
